title: Profile and Collection feedback
body:
I just took part in this extended survey that popped up and thought that what I wrote about the two profile and collection pages would be nice to discuss with others, so I'm posting it here as well.

# Profile

First Win of the Day bonus, ARAM reroll points (and IP boost) don't belong to the profile page imo. Especially because they are only shown if you view *your* profile page, which otherwise looks identical to any other profile page.
Instead, these should go next to the IP and RP counters.

The champion background is a nice idea, but the underlying algorithm is very inconsistent to the point where I don't get it at all. It would be better if it was user-configurable.

# Collection

Information about champion chests is missing. It would be nice if I could even sort the champion list by that so I don't have to rely on external sites or a custom text file in order to find out which champions I have owned chests for already.

Talking about sorting, the sort order radio buttons for the champions page seems kinda slapped onto it since it has no explanation around it, unlike in the store where the up and down arrows (↑↓) provide more context.

Champion details pages have the champions' lore also kinda sticked onto it. The text is very small and the text area as well, meaning you still have to scroll a lot. I suggest adding a separate "Lore" tab, like there was previously, next to the Skins one.

The other collection pages (masteries, runes, spells) are great though. And the champion detail pages, too (abilities tab best tab).

# Responsiveness

The hover delay of 1s (?) is too high. It makes the client feel very unresponsive. Instead, it should be lowered to 300-400ms.

---

*What do you think?*

replies.body: Responsiveness is definitely something we are not completely happy with. We are looking at several improvements that we could make right now.

Ya, especially the responsiveness of the Lobby button must be fixed.

If I'm not mistaken you're actually loading in the whole Lobby section into the client when the user first clicks on the Lobby button, right? Because the first time I click on it after launching the client it takes almost 2-3 seconds before I'm actually shown the lobby page. Which is unacceptable since it's such a paramount section and it doesn't actually show a "loading" progress bar.

You should probably, if possible, add the whole lobby page to be cached during the login procedure to the client.
The only responsiveness issue I have is when I hover over runes and masteries. Everything else feels doable in my opinion, but putting together a rune page feels painful almost.
